solution_line_template: If there are {uniforms} uniforms, and the lab coats are {coats_multiplier} times as many as the number of uniforms, there are {coats_multiplier}*{uniforms} = <<{uniforms}*{coats_multiplier}={lab_coats}>>{lab_coats} lab coats.
The total number of lab coats and uniforms in the lab is {lab_coats}+{uniforms} = <<{lab_coats}+{uniforms}={total_coats_and_uniforms}>>{total_coats_and_uniforms}
If the number of lab techs is half the number of uniforms, then there are {uniforms}/{techs_divisor} = <<{uniforms}/{techs_divisor}={lab_techs}>>{lab_techs} lab techs

If they share the lab coats and uniforms equally, each lab tech will get {total_coats_and_uniforms}/{lab_techs} = <<{total_coats_and_uniforms}/{lab_techs}={coats_and_uniforms_per_tech}>>{coats_and_uniforms_per_tech} lab coats and uniforms.
